gcci.text: At an average H100 price of $3.14/hr, the hardware market shows easing supply-chain constraints, yet tight chip availability and premium deployments keep capex elevated for frontier AI training clusters.

gtpi.text: An average input price of $1.36/1M tokens is accelerating API price wars, pushing providers to prioritize token efficiency and context optimization to maintain margins amid intense model competition.

gagl.text: A 120 TWh annual AI load introduces meaningful grid strain and emissions exposure, making incremental nuclear capacity and firm low-carbon power essential for reliable, sustainable scaling.

aipi.text: Industry sentiment remains cautiously expansionary as compute prices normalize and token costs compress, but rising energy demand and capital intensity elevate bubble and sustainability risks without firmer grid and power solutions.
